availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George B. Moss (Hickman County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Farmer in Hickman County in 1860. Household owned twenty-seven enslaved persons in Hickman County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Columbus, p. 488.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Columbus, p. 202A.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Hickman County Administration Bonds, 1830-1869; Vol 19-20, 1970-1975, p. 74 of microfilm (Accessed via Ancestry.com on August 18, 2020).
